Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

Post.title: docker + clash
Post._content:
```
#!/bin/bash

set -e

echo "  Privoxy..."
sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y privoxy

echo "  Privoxy  SOCKS5  HTTP..."

# 
sudo tee /etc/privoxy/config > /dev/null <<EOF
listen-address 127.0.0.1:8118
forward-socks5   /               127.0.0.1:7897 .
EOF

echo "  Privoxy..."
sudo systemctl restart privoxy
sudo systemctl enable privoxy

echo "  Docker  HTTP ..."

sudo mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d

sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/http-proxy.conf > /dev/null <<EOF
[Service]
Environment="HTTP_PROXY=http://127.0.0.1:8118"
Environment="HTTPS_PROXY=http://127.0.0.1:8118"
EOF

echo "  systemd  Docker ..."
sudo systemctl daemon-reexec
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl restart docker

echo "  Docker "
echo "   docker pull hello-world"

```

## 3.  main.cf  TLS  SASL



```conf
#  TLS  SASL relayhost  [smtp.qq.com]:587
smtp_use_tls = yes
smtp_sasl_auth_enable = yes
smtp_sasl_password_maps = hash:/etc/postfix/sasl_passwd
smtp_sasl_security_options = noanonymous
smtp_sasl_tls_security_options = noanonymous
# 
# debug_peer_level = 2
```

```sh
sudo vim /etc/postfix/main.cf
```

```sh

```




```sh
sudo postmap /etc/postfix/sasl_passwd
sudo chmod 600 /etc/postfix/sasl_passwd*
```

```sh
grep "^myhostname" /etc/postfix/main.cf
# myhostname = iehtian-VMware-Virtual-Platform
```

 generic 

```sh

```

```conf
iehtian@iehtian-VMware-Virtual-Platform youremail@qq.com

```



```bash
brew install socat
```
